fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Install JIRA using installer in Linux environment.
# Perform upgrade using installer.
# Process will stops at "Checking for local modification" until it takes up all memory allocated for JIRA instance.

h4. Diagnosis
There might be foreign files such as symbolic links in JIRA Home directory that might messed the checking process.

h4. Workaround
Locate the symlink by *{{sudo find -type l}}* command in terminal.

h4. Expected behavior
Checking should only focus on JIRA configuration files rather than external files. 

h4. Error logs
{code}
Checking for local modifications.
An error occurred:
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
Error log: /home/user/install4jError576969599009603384.log
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
    at java.lang.StringCoding$StringEncoder.encode(Unknown Source)
    at java.lang.StringCoding.encode(Unknown Source)
    at java.lang.String.getBytes(Unknown Source)
    at java.io.UnixFileSystem.getBooleanAttributes0(Native Method)
    at java.io.UnixFileSystem.getBooleanAttributes(Unknown Source)
    at java.io.File.isDirectory(Unknown Source)
    at com.atlassian.modzdetector.ModzDetector.getAddedFiles(ModzDetector.java:182)
    at com.atlassian.modzdetector.ModzDetector.getAddedFiles(ModzDetector.java:184)
 ...
{code}
fields.summary: Recursive Checking during Upgrade using Linux Installer will results 'GC Overhead Limit Exceeded' error

Users who are familiar with mainstream SQL expect to be able to specify date fields down to the second.

We would like to be able to format JQL queries as follows:

createdDate >= "2013-01-11 00:00:00" and createdDate <= "2013-01-11 23:59:59"

We know that date data is stored in the database down to the second, as using createdDate <= "2013-01-11 23:59" excludes any issues created during the last minute of the day.

fields.description:
I upgraded from 4.4.1 to 5.2.4 and I have enabled sending email but not reading email with:


{noformat}
DISABLE_NOTIFICATIONS=" -Datlassian.mail.senddisabled=false - Datlassian.mail.fetchdisabled=true -Datlassian.mail.popdisabled=true"
{noformat}

Sending email with no authentication via Exchange works fine. But using authentication produces the message


{noformat}
An error has occurred with sending the test email:
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPSendFailedException: 550 5.7.1 Client does not have permissions to send as this sender
{noformat}

Googling found http://community.office365.com/en-us/forums/160/p/77364/296367.aspx#296367 which suggests that this is a response from Exchange when the From address doesn't match the userid that authenticated with Exchange.

Sure enough, when I changed the From address in my mail server configuration to match the user id that authenticated with Exchange, it worked.

*This regression is likely going to be a problem for people who have been using different From addresses for each JIRA project* in their Notification Scheme configuration (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Email+Notifications#ConfiguringEmailNotifications-Configuringaproject'semailaddress)

More information at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/114796/jira-unable-to-send-mail-after-5-2-upgrade?page=1#123213

*Workaround*
Please refer to [550 5.7.1 Unable to Relay Mail From Exchange Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/550+5.7.1+Unable+to+Relay+Mail+From+Exchange+Server] for a list of symptoms and the resolution.
fields.summary: Exchange with authentication requires From address matches the authenticated user

Currently the only way to educate users on the meaning of custom field options is to describe them all in the Description - this produces a very long block of text that takes up space on the page and annoys the more experienced users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31227].
  {panel}

I'm considering moving from Podio to JIRA. I'd like to note that Podio is horrible at a lot of things that JIRA is excellent at, however there are two things that makes Podio very useful that JIRA does not have. One of those things is the Notification Center

Basically, I don't want to check my email for new updates to JIRA. I want all those updates to be piled up in a notification center, kind of like how Facebook does it. I don't want to have to refresh the screen. I don't even want to have to switch to the tab to find out if there are any new notifications for me.

1) When a ticket is assigned to me, or when I am @mentioned in a comment, or when a ticket that is assigned to me gets updated or commented on, I want a notification.
2) I want the notification to appear automatically in a little box along the top bar of the page (an icon with a number over it). I don't want to have to refresh the page in order to see if I have new notifications.
3) I want the number of unacknowledged notifications I have to appear in the title of the page, so that I can be browsing in other tabs and still be aware of when a new notification comes in.
4) I want everything to be very simple; I don't want to have to click multiple times to acknowledge a notification to make it go away. Simply clicking once on the notification and viewing it should be enough.
5) I want a backlog of my notification history.
6) When I click on the notification, I want to be taken to the item that triggered it.
fields.summary: Notification Center

fields.description:
In 5.1, in the new Issue Navigator where what is now called Basic Search was called Simple Search, a user could select from a selection list of components in the same way as issue types, etc.(see attachment).  Since the change to the new Issue Navigator in 5.2, component is no longer available in this way.  I appreciate that it can be searched for via advanced search but this a problem for 2 reasons:
1.  Some users of this system are not that literate and doing things like JQL is possibly a bit beyond them and is going to be error-prone (I will get support calls!).  The point of the simple search is to cater for these people and to make life easier for all of us - this doesn't!
2.  I do not wish to expose the field names to every user (not so much an issue with component as with other fields (will be raising further related bugs)) and for something as basic as component, this should not be necessary.

A step backwards!
fields.summary: Not possible to search by Component in Basic Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31210].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

We need to review the following documentation:

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+Bugzilla

When importing data from BugZilla, JIRA needs to connect on its database using an external driver. However, JIRA is unable to connect in previous MySQL databases such as MySQL 4.0 (which is used by BugZilla 2.20 -- a really old version).

So where it said:

{quote}
Version 4.1 or later of the JIRA Importers plugin is compatible with Bugzilla 2.20 to 4.0.2. Users of older Bugzilla versions will need to first upgrade the Bugzilla database tables to a supported version, using Bugzilla's checksetup.pl script. The JIRA Importers plugin requires that your Bugzilla database is MySQL, PostgreSQL or Microsoft SQL Server.
{quote}

We shall specify that JIRA is able to import data from BugZilla 2.20 *only* if it's using a [supported database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] -- In this case, MySQL 5.1 or higher.

Best regards,
Lucas Timm
fields.summary: Review documentation "Importing Data from Bugzilla"

Currently a user without 'Browse Users' permission using the 'WAS' operator to do a search like "reporter was username" returns an error stating "username" does not exist, no matter what username is used in the search.
Running the search "reporter = username" results in all issues with that reporter successfully.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Log in with an user without 'Browse Users' global permission;
# Search for "reporter = <username>" where <username> can be any user from JIRA; Results are displayed successfully; 
# Search for "reporter WAS <username>"; JIRA displays error message stating <username> does not exists.

*Expected Results:*
JIRA should have the same behavior for both operators. Require 'Browse Users' permission for both or none.

*Actual Results:*
WAS operator requires 'Browse Users' permission while = does not.

fields.description:
It seems that jira installer/upgrader is doing a recursive chown and chmod on jira home directory. 

That it takes ages (>30 minutes so far and still counting). 

In order to perform the upgrade I had to kill these processes!!!

This is a big problem as Jira is releasing new updates quite often and this **increase the downtime of the system** making impossible to achieve a 99% SLA.

If needed the chown should be done before shutting down current instance, not after.

281,000 files in database table
304,000 files listed with "find . -t file >/tmp/attachments.list"
stored as 590 GB on NAS partition
23 minutes only to list them!
150,000 issues in database

The `chown` and `chmod` commands from the installer to take forever to run, increasing the
fields.summary: Jira installer is doing a recursive chown/chmod on jira home directory which takes an enormous amount of time

!description.png!

Then, on the notification email, the content does not rendered the wiki markup:

h4. Note: 
* The field description is already configured to Wiki Style Renderer
* Tested on JIRA 5.1.2, 5.1.3, 5.2.4, 6.1.2, 6.1.5
* When creating the issue, the first notification formats correctly
* Subsequent updates will not render the wiki markup
* Any new comments on the issue will show the description un-rendered in the notifications, but will show the comment rendered correctly if there is any wiki formatting in the comment.
* Any edits on existing comments will not render the wiki markup

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31193].
  {panel}

Auto-highlighting of entire field upon selection for inline editing makes it easy to delete entire description.

We've just launched Jira defect management in the past couple weeks, and have multiple people notice the following issue: 
1. clicking on a field opens it up for inline editing. 
2. opening a free text field for inline editing highlights the entire text body. 
3. clicking off field saves changes to the selected field. 
This combination of factors causes this to happen: 

1. a laptop user is typing something anywhere (e.g. a word document, or the quick search field). 
2. as can easily happen with a laptop touchpad, they brush against the touchpad, which it interprets as a left-click. 
3. because the mouse arrow was currently hovering over the description field, the description is opened for editing and the entire description is highlighted. 
4. not noticing that focus has changed, the user continues typing, causing the entire description to be deleted. 
5. The user notices that what they have been typing is not appearing in the quick search field, and they click on the quick search field. 
6. the deletion of the description is saved. 

In most cases, people have noticed when they've accidentally deleted large blocks of text. But sometimes they haven't and it has only been caught because a watcher received an edit notification and they questioned why this would happen.
fields.summary: Don't auto-highlight entire field upon inline edit

fields.description:
We use validators in the Create transition, hope this is supported at all.

This let's us do all kind of validations. One of them is to check if a field is not empty if another field has a specific value. This validation works great when we create issues using the "Create Issue" link.

Now when the issue is cloned and the validation condition does not match (e.g. because the input variables for the condition changed) the operation silently fails and the issue is displayed with two self referencing links.
!Screenshot-17.png!

This should be easily reproducable by just changing the validating condition of the create transition to fail always. In this case, one cannot clone issues attached to the changed workflow anymore.

If an error message would be displayed and the issue would not have two links that would be ok but as it is implemented now, JIRA creates inconsistencies in the issue.

This should be fixed IMHO
fields.summary: Cloning leaves issue with two strange self referencing issue links when validator in "Create" transition fails

fields.description:
h5. Problem:

When trying to retrieve particular status, it would return "Internal Server Error" from JIRA through REST api:
{code}
http://example.com:8080/rest/api/2.0.alpha1/status/1
http://example.com:8080/rest/api/latest/status/1
{code} 

It only happens if the workflow scheme(which *All Unassigned Issue Types" not assigned to any workflow) associated to the first project(arrangement based on the prefix eg. 1Test or ABC). It doesn't happen when that custom workflow scheme assigned to other project in the list.  

h5. Error Message:
{code}
{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}
{code}

h5. Stacktrace from the logs:

{code}
2013-01-03 17:26:10,844 TP-Processor3 ERROR xxxx 1046x446967x1 h6cqu1 xx.xx.xx.xx /rest/api/latest/status/1 [jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor4058.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.config.DefaultConstantsService.getWorkflows(DefaultConstantsService.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.config.DefaultConstantsService.getStatusById(DefaultConstantsService.java:77)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor4010.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
...
{code}

h5. Replication Step:
# Create a workflow scheme assigned one of the any issue type(eg. Bug or Improvement) except *All Unassigned Issue Types".
# Create a project with named 1TEST(so it would be at the first of the prject list)
# Associate the workflow scheme to the project 1TEST
# Run a rest command to query the status open:
{code}
curl http://example.com:8080/rest/api/latest/status/1
{code}
# It will returns Internal Server Error

h5. Workaround
* Reassign any other workflow schemes where *All Unassigned Issue Types* are assigned to a workflow.
* Add *All Unassigned Issue Types* to the custom workflow schemes.
* Upgrade to JIRA 5.x
fields.summary: REST API returns "Internal Server Error" for status request

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31184].
  {panel}

At present the backup produced by the backup manager cannot be imported back into OnDemand as the attachments and XML are in the same zip file. Could the Backup Manager produce 3 zip files:

* XML
* Avatars (taken directly from the avatars directory)
* Attachments (taken directly from the attachments directory)

This is useful for customers as if they need to make a risky change to JIRA and take a backup before and after then it's not possible for them to restore the data without downloading the archive and manually altering it.

WORKAROUND:
[Restoring a JIRA Cloud Backup into a JIRA Cloud instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Restoring+a+JIRA+Cloud+Backup+into+a+JIRA+Cloud+instance]

# Download the backup
# Extract all files out of the zip file
# Zip up entities.xml and activeobjects.xml - this will be your XML data.
# Change directory into data/attachments and zip up the contents - this will be your attachment data.
# Change directory into data/avatars and zip up the contents - this will be your avatar data.
# [Import the file back into OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Issues]
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand Backup Manager should produce a backup that can be imported back into OnDemand

As an example, if the name of a project is ‘Test & Trouble’ the drop down will show ‘Test & Trouble’

Please see the error on the attached screenshot:


!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/82603/special_chars.png!

The create issue screen will remember the previous issue creation's field configuration.  For example:
# Make the component field not required and create an issue without the component field on the screen.  The create issue screen will remember the previous field configuration
!step1.png!
# Make the component field required
!step2.png!
# Try to create an issue and the component field will not be displayed on the create issue screen
!step3.png!

However, when a user tries to create an issue, the component field will automatically appear on the screen, and JIRA will prompt an exception requesting for a value for the required field. 

It would be convenient for users to know what fields are required when creating an issue, regardless of the previous field configuration.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create three custom fields with the same name and different type. [^Screen1BUGREPORT.jpg]
2. Go to any workflow transition and add a new POST FUNCTION, of type *Copy Value From Other Field* function.
3. Only one of the three created custom fields is shown. [^Screen2BUGREPORT.jpg]
fields.summary: "Copy Value From Other Field" Post Function does not show all Custom Fields with Same Name When Selecting From Dropdown Box
Embedded image in Documentation does not same as in JIRA instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31147].
  {panel}

When an Administrator is editing the JIRA Announcement Banner, there are two possible "Visibility Level" options:

Public - Show to anyone
Private - Show to logged in users only 

It would be useful to have a third option:

Disable - Banner Inactive

This would allow the administrator to turn the banner on and off without losing the banner.  The banner represents an investment in admin time (getting the colour right, the alignment just-so, etc) and being able to disable the banner means that this work can be re-used without need to archive the HTML text externally.
fields.summary: Disable Option For Announcement Banner

fields.summary: Anonymous user comments shouldn't show user details on hover

fields.description: The Custom setting allows a user to uncheck (undisplay) some mandatory fields.  Normally, a mandatory field is always shown and the Custom Form setting does not have a check box for it.  The field in question is always required for the Scheme in question.
fields.summary: Some required fields do not show up when using the "Configuration Fields" - Custom Form setting

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*

# In issue search, open an issue's actions (cog) menu and click "Edit".
# Close the edit dialog that appears.
# Press 'j' to highlight the next issue.
# Press 'e' to edit the highlighted issue.

*Result*

A dialog opens to edit the issue from step 1, not the currently highlighted issue. Immediately after closing the dialog, another one appears.

*Expected Result*

The dialog should be for the highlighted issue and it should only open once.
fields.summary: Duplicate dialogs and incorrect issue keys after opening the issue actions menu

fields.description:
The behavior is the same up through  Jira 5.2 (v5.2#812-sha1:c4fbab6).
1. Set up one or more fields with more than one Context.
2. Have a Default Value for each Context.
3. Use "+Create Issue" button to bring up Create Form.
4. Check fields to ensure the proper Default Value for the given Context are set correctly.
5. Change the Project to one which also has a Default Value for the Field(s) in question.
6. Notice the value in the Field(s) is now set to None or are blank.
fields.summary: Fields with Contexts do not have their default values set properly on Create form when switching from project to project
